Description: Hemishperical pottery bowl, hand-made, with a black lustrous interior and rim and a red ochre-covered exterior. Immediately below the rim on the exterior is a register of incised pendant triangles infilled with vertical, closely spaced lines.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Northern Dongola Reach, Site P37 Grave (G3)3
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2003 10 Apr-31 Aug, Barcelona, CaixaForum, Nubia: Los reinos del Nilo en Sudan 2003/4 23 Sep-4 Jan, Madrid, Sala de Exposiciones de la Fundacio, Nubia: Los reinos del Nilo en Sudan
Acquisition name: Donated by: National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums (NCAM)
